title: In regard to Zhonya's Hourglass: Riot why aren't you doing the things you're purporting to be doing?
body:
PLEASE READ FULLY BEFORE VOTING AND COMMENTING, THANKS <3
EDIT: Oh and if you're just gonna be a dick then please, don't bother commenting at all.


From the patch notes:
> >...so we’re going all-in on its identity as a _**defensive utility item**_. That decision has allowed us to drop the price of Zhonya’s to the lowest it’s ever been in League history,_** making it more readily available in times its stasis effect is truly needed.**_

Except you haven't, because you've simultaneously upped the Stasis cooldown to a whopping 120 seconds! (That's Level 1 Ultimate levels of cooldown)
So are you really making it more readily available? No not really, because all this change has done has rejigged the gate to the stasis. Before it was Hourglass's cost, now it's the really high cooldown. This change hasn't actually done anything regarding the Stasis active. 

Not to mention the armour is also lower thanks to previous nerfs. I'd have said go whole hog or not at all on making it a _**defensive utility item**_. Because when we factor in the sheer amount of Armour Pen available to AD Mid-laners that 45 Armour is even weaker. 

Am I just not seeing this properly? Or am I really onto something here?
Sure, it's considerably more gold efficient than before, even more so as a rush item but I'm just getting mixed signals between what Riot is purporting and what has actually changed. 

Anyone else wanna weigh in on this? I'm curious to hear other's thoughts.

So if you were buying Morello first before 6.9, you should still like it a lot now, and you are not forced into Tear-builds.

Athene has been changed into a supportive item, but that doesn't mean you cannot build it on Oriana or Lulu Mid depending on the rest of your Team comp.

For Artillery mages that bought Athene before, yes, you should probably go for Tear now, but even without Tear, if you build something like RoA/Morello/GLP007, you should have plenty of mana, even in late game (and those are 3 good items even if you don't take the mana into account).

Now, if you do accept to take Battle Mages into account, or even champs like Annie and Lissandra, or if you take an off-meta pick and go top with a Mage against a Melee champ, you also have a whole category of Mages that will like the new Catalyst a lot, either into RoA for the pile of stats or into GLP for the defense/utility, depending on your playstyle.

They've actually explained this.

Supports, by their nature, are not allowed a lot of freedom. They have to be constantly on the roam to ward, cover teammates, set up teamfights, and just be around the map all the time. They aren't allowed to go back often, but at the same time they can't have much downtime, so they need regen to operate.

Mages, on the other hand, have a far broader amount of roles to them. Sure, there're mages that want to roam all over the place and get stuff done, but before they're more powerful than supports the supports don't really have mana regen anyway, and once they are more powerful gating their power by forcing them to go back or keep blue buff on themselves can keep them from becoming excessive. But that's just one class of mage - and if they had mana regen items, then so would the mages that just constantly wave clear and poke down the enemy team and the barrages would never stop.

I'd also like the bring back up the point that early on, mana regen is flat-out terrible pretty much. Alternative sources of mana regain are far more potent and so is maximum mana, all without tricking the player into thinking that they'll be able to do more if they just stayed out for a bit longer. Not only do you get more spells out of max mana early on, but it helps keep it obvious when you should go back if you don't have access to blue buff.

They actually did say why in an older post (though admittedly not in the patch notes from which you quoted as it should've been reiterated there), they want to differentiate the stats AP midlaners and AP supports desire with the goal being that midlaners will stop abusing support items forcing them to gut said items for both roles.
